title: Lists - Ordered Collections
reading_content:
Working with Lists

Lists are ordered, mutable collections that can hold items of different types.

Creating Lists:

numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"]

Modifying Lists:

fruits = ["apple", "banana"]
fruits.append("cherry")  # Add to end
starter_code:
# Create a list with numbers 1, 2, 3
# Add the number 4 to the list
# Print the entire list
learning_objectives: Use list methods (append, insert, remove, etc.)
hints: Create a list using square brackets: [1, 2, 3]
Use my_list.append(4) to add an item
